solution:
Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{7}{8} \div 3 \frac{3}{8} = \frac{15}{8} \div \frac{27}{8}$
$\frac{15}{8} \times \frac{8}{27}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{2} \div 2 \frac{1}{4} = \frac{5}{2} \div \frac{9}{4}$
$= \frac{5}{2} \times \frac{4}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{5} \div 2 \frac{2}{3} = \frac{8}{5} \div \frac{8}{3}$
$= \frac{8}{5} \times \frac{3}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{3} \div 1 \frac{3}{5} = \frac{4}{3} \div \frac{8}{5}$
$= \frac{4}{3} \times \frac{5}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{2} \div 1 \frac{1}{3} = \frac{5}{2} \div \frac{4}{3}$
$= \frac{5}{2} \times \frac{3}{4}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{2}{4} \div 1 \frac{4}{6} = \frac{10}{4} \div \frac{10}{6}$
$= \frac{10}{4} \times \frac{6}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{2} \div 1 \frac{2}{7} = \frac{5}{2} \div \frac{9}{7}$
$= \frac{5}{2} \times \frac{7}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{4} \div 1 \frac{2}{8} = \frac{6}{4} \div \frac{10}{8}$
$= \frac{6}{4} \times \frac{8}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{5} \div 2 \frac{1}{4} = \frac{7}{5} \div \frac{9}{4}$
$= \frac{7}{5} \times \frac{4}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{9} \div 1 \frac{1}{3} = \frac{10}{9} \div \frac{4}{3}$
$= \frac{10}{9} \times \frac{3}{4}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{5} \div 1 \frac{2}{7} = \frac{7}{5} \div \frac{9}{7}$
$= \frac{7}{5} \times \frac{7}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{7} \div 1 \frac{1}{2} = \frac{8}{7} \div \frac{3}{2}$
$= \frac{8}{7} \times \frac{2}{3}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{4} \div 1 \frac{3}{6} = \frac{9}{4} \div \frac{9}{6}$
$= \frac{9}{4} \times \frac{6}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$3 \frac{1}{3} \div 1 \frac{1}{5} = \frac{10}{3} \div \frac{6}{5}$
$= \frac{10}{3} \times \frac{5}{6}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{2} \div 1 \frac{2}{4} = \frac{5}{2} \div \frac{6}{4}$
$= \frac{5}{2} \times \frac{4}{6}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{7} \div 1 \frac{1}{4} = \frac{10}{7} \div \frac{5}{4}$
$= \frac{10}{7} \times \frac{4}{5}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{7} \div 1 \frac{1}{8} = \frac{10}{7} \div \frac{9}{8}$
$= \frac{10}{7} \times \frac{8}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{3} \div 1 \frac{3}{7} = \frac{4}{3} \div \frac{10}{7}$
$= \frac{4}{3} \times \frac{7}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{3} \div 1 \frac{2}{6} = \frac{4}{3} \div \frac{8}{6}$
$= \frac{4}{3} \times \frac{6}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{4}{6} \div 1 \frac{2}{6} = \frac{10}{6} \div \frac{8}{6}$
$= \frac{10}{6} \times \frac{6}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{2} \div 1 \frac{4}{6} = \frac{3}{2} \div \frac{10}{6}$
$= \frac{3}{2} \times \frac{6}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{4} \div 1 \frac{4}{5} = \frac{6}{4} \div \frac{9}{5}$
$= \frac{6}{4} \times \frac{5}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{3} \div 1 \frac{1}{6} = \frac{7}{3} \div \frac{7}{6}$
$= \frac{7}{3} \times \frac{6}{7}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{8} \div 1 \frac{2}{8} = \frac{9}{8} \div \frac{10}{8}$
$= \frac{9}{8} \times \frac{8}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{5} \div 1 \frac{1}{7} = \frac{8}{5} \div \frac{8}{7}$
$= \frac{8}{5} \times \frac{7}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{2}{4} \div 3 \frac{1}{3} = \frac{10}{4} \div \frac{10}{3}$
$= \frac{10}{4} \times \frac{3}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{5} \div 1 \frac{3}{6} = \frac{8}{5} \div \frac{9}{6}$
$= \frac{8}{5} \times \frac{6}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{4}{5} \div 2 \frac{1}{3} = \frac{9}{5} \div \frac{7}{3}$
$= \frac{9}{5} \times \frac{3}{7}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{4} \div 1 \frac{2}{5} = \frac{6}{4} \div \frac{7}{5}$
$= \frac{6}{4} \times \frac{5}{7}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{3} \div 2 \frac{1}{3} = \frac{5}{3} \div \frac{7}{3}$
$= \frac{5}{3} \times \frac{3}{7}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{4}{5} \div 1 \frac{2}{7} = \frac{9}{5} \div \frac{9}{7}$
$= \frac{9}{5} \times \frac{7}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{2}{4} \div 2 \frac{2}{4} = \frac{10}{4} \div \frac{10}{4}$
$= \frac{10}{4} \times \frac{4}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{6} \div 1 \frac{3}{6} = \frac{9}{6} \div \frac{9}{6}$
$= \frac{9}{6} \times \frac{6}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{5} \div 1 \frac{1}{6} = \frac{6}{5} \div \frac{7}{6}$
$= \frac{6}{5} \times \frac{6}{7}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{5} \div 1 \frac{1}{9} = \frac{8}{5} \div \frac{10}{9}$
$= \frac{8}{5} \times \frac{9}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{5} \div 1 \frac{2}{3} = \frac{8}{5} \div \frac{5}{3}$
$= \frac{8}{5} \times \frac{3}{5}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{4} \div 1 \frac{3}{5} = \frac{9}{4} \div \frac{8}{5}$
$= \frac{9}{4} \times \frac{5}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{3} \div 1 \frac{1}{5} = \frac{7}{3} \div \frac{6}{5}$
$= \frac{7}{3} \times \frac{5}{6}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{4} \div 1 \frac{2}{8} = \frac{5}{4} \div \frac{10}{8}$
$= \frac{5}{4} \times \frac{8}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{4}{5} \div 2 \frac{2}{4} = \frac{9}{5} \div \frac{10}{4}$
$= \frac{9}{5} \times \frac{4}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{8} \div 1 \frac{3}{7} = \frac{10}{8} \div \frac{10}{7}$
$= \frac{10}{8} \times \frac{7}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{4} \div 1 \frac{1}{9} = \frac{7}{4} \div \frac{10}{9}$
$= \frac{7}{4} \times \frac{9}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{4}{6} \div 1 \frac{2}{3} = \frac{10}{6} \div \frac{5}{3}$
$= \frac{10}{6} \times \frac{3}{5}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{5} \div 1 \frac{1}{8} = \frac{6}{5} \div \frac{9}{8}$
$= \frac{6}{5} \times \frac{8}{9}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{5} \div 1 \frac{2}{4} = \frac{8}{5} \div \frac{6}{4}$
$= \frac{8}{5} \times \frac{4}{6}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{4} \div 2 \frac{2}{3} = \frac{6}{4} \div \frac{8}{3}$
$= \frac{6}{4} \times \frac{3}{8}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$2 \frac{1}{2} \div 1 \frac{2}{3} = \frac{5}{2} \div \frac{5}{3}$
$= \frac{5}{2} \times \frac{3}{5}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{3}{7} \div 2 \frac{1}{2} = \frac{10}{7} \div \frac{5}{2}$
$= \frac{10}{7} \times \frac{2}{5}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{4} \div 3 \frac{1}{2} = \frac{6}{4} \div \frac{7}{2}$
$= \frac{6}{4} \times \frac{2}{7}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{2}{4} \div 1 \frac{4}{6} = \frac{6}{4} \div \frac{10}{6}$
$= \frac{6}{4} \times \frac{6}{10}$

Turn this from a division problem into a multiplication problem by multiplying by the reciprocal.
$1 \frac{1}{5} \div 1 \frac{4}{6} = \frac{6}{5} \div \frac{10}{6}$
$= \frac{6}{5} \times \frac{6}{10}$
